WRITING.TEXT: Thats not true at all. I have 1.5k hours on PC and haven't met a lot of hackers since the last 3 months and over all its not as bad as you said.

WRITING.TITLE: Tyranid Tournament list. What do you think of it?
WRITING.TEXT: This is my Tyranid list for a local tournament against mainly marines. **++ Battalion Detachment +5CP (Tyranids) [51 PL, 8CP, 850pts] ++** **+ No Force Org Slot +** **Battle-forged CP [3CP]** **Detachment CP [5CP]** **Hive Fleet:** Kraken **+ HQ +** **Broodlord [8 PL, 115pts]:** Power: Smite, Power: Synaptic Lure, Resonance Barb **Malanthropes [5 PL, 120pts]** . **Malanthrope** **+ Troops +** **Genestealers [12 PL, 180pts]:** 3x Acid Maw, 15x Scything Talons . **15x Genestealer:** 15x Rending Claws **Genestealers [12 PL, 180pts]:** 3x Acid Maw, 15x Scything Talons . **15x Genestealer:** 15x Rending Claws **Hormagaunts [9 PL, 150pts]:** 30x Hormagaunt **+ Heavy Support +** **Stone Crusher Carnifex Brood [5 PL, 105pts]** . **Stone Crusher Carnifex:** 2x Wrecker Claws, Thresher Scythe **++ Battalion Detachment +5CP (Tyranids) [55 PL, 4CP, 900pts] ++** **+ No Force Org Slot +** **Detachment CP [5CP]** **Hive Fleet:** Kronos **Stratagem: Progeny of the Hive [-1CP]** **+ HQ +** **Hive Tyrant [11 PL, 208pts]:** Heavy Venom Cannon, Monstrous Rending Claws, Power: Catalyst, Power: Smite, Power: The Horror, Wings **Neurothrope [4 PL, 90pts]:** Power: Smite, Power: Symbiostorm, Warlord **+ Troops +** **Ripper Swarms [2 PL, 33pts]:** 3x Ripper Swarm **Termagants [3 PL, 40pts]** . **10x Termagant (Fleshborer)** **Termagants [6 PL, 44pts]** . **11x Termagant (Fleshborer)** **Termagants [3 PL, 40pts]** . **10x Termagant (Fleshborer)** **+ Elites +** **Hive Guard [7 PL, 129pts]** . **3x Hive Guard (Impaler):** 3x Impaler Cannon **+ Heavy Support +** **Biovores [2 PL, 40pts]:** Biovore **Carnifexes [6 PL, 121pts]** . **Carnifex:** Bone Mace, Enhanced Senses, Heavy Venom Cannon, Spore Cysts, Two Deathspitters with Slimer Maggots . . **Adaptive Physiology:** Dermic Symbiosis **Exocrine [11 PL, 155pts]** . **Adaptive Physiology:** Dermic Symbiosis **++ Total: [106 PL, 12CP, 1,750pts] ++** Created with [BattleScribe](https://www.battlescribe.net)
I have some of the problems you have stated here. Can you explain me how to verify my game and clear the said files?

Try to get some cheap troops like Termagants or Hormagaunts on ebay or try to get the Tyranid Battleforce Box on ebay or at the GW website around Christmas. It has a great selection of models and a good price.
Hello Richard, Do you have some general tips for Nids? Like how to make a good list that will have board control and hard hitting units to fight mostly marines?
Okay, thanks for your advice, i will take it into consideration
Thanks, I think I can improve my game with this knowledge
I think the prequels are the best. Im just loving the Jedi and Clonetroopers.
How does Rockstar force you to buy Shark Cards?
At the top right of the map. You can see a small pond on the map, between the ocean and the highway.
Yes it sure is
Looks good, try to add some more weathering imo. Keep it up!
Megamind?

I would add a Magus with Might From Beyond for +1 Attacks and +1 Strength. Then you could also add a Acolyte Iconward with Icon of the Cult Ascended for another +1 Strength. If you want to bring this to the Max you can add a Primus for exploding 5's and 6's for the Abominant aura. Paint the whe Thing as Twisted helix for +1 Strength and the possible to attack twice. 8 Abberants with picks and 2 Abberant Hyphermorphs net you 20A S16 AP -1 D2, 32A S8 AP -2 D3, 32A S8 from Rending Claws and 2A S8 AP -1 D1 from the Hyphermorph Tails. All with explosive 5's and 6's hitting on 2's. Thanks if you read that. Your paint job and base are awesome. I love that model.

WRITING.TITLE: Advise on destruction warlocks in pvp
WRITING.TEXT: I just came back to wow and would like sime tips and tricks to play destruction warlocks against other players in area and BG games.
Well that didnt work that good the last few trys
Thanks for that! Do you have some advice for azerite traits and corruptions?
Thanks for that detailed guide! This helped me a lot
This really hurts Genestealer Cults, as they have a ton of +1 Strength bonuses
There was a wookie padawan in the Clone Wars series and in the new High Republic Era there will be another wookie Jedi
What? Any info why?
Ork with C? Are you serious?
I sure hope it was
Thanks I hate it
I love democracy

That's gross, thanks for the explanation

Valrak wins
Ridgerunners?

WRITING.TITLE: This competetive try on Ynnari/Drukhari
WRITING.TEXT: This is a Ynnari/Drukhari list i made for my friend. I dont play neither of these armies but I just had this idea in my head. I hope somebody can tell me if its good. Thanks for reading this. For the four armed Empe-Eh Commorragh! The general idea is the witches handling MEQs and GEQs led by the Succubus. Plus the Razorwing which could be exchanged for a Voidraven. The 10 man squads use the raiders to get some fast movement. Yvraine uses psychic powers to give the units survivability and regaining wounds. The Scourges and Reavers focus the heavy heavy targets. Some haywire for high invuln vehicles. The Yncarne dies what he does best: appearing somewhere and wreck havoc. That's the main plan. Secondaries could be: Bring it down Engage on all fronts Grind them down ++ Battalion Detachment 0CP (Aeldari - Drukhari) [97 PL, 11CP, 1,999pts] ++ + Configuration + Battle Size [12CP]: 3. Strike Force (101-200 Total PL / 1001-2000 Points) Detachment CP Detachment Type: Ynnari Detachment + Stratagems + Stratagem: Exalted of Ynnead [-1CP] + HQ + Succubus [3 PL, 60pts]: Archite Glaive, Blast Pistol, The Lost Shroud, Walker of Many Paths, Warlord The Yncarne [15 PL, 290pts]: 4. Unbind Souls, 6. Ancestors' Grace Yvraine [6 PL, 120pts]: 3. Word of the Phoenix, 5. Shield of Ynnead + Troops + Kabalite Warriors [3 PL, 50pts] . 4x Kabalite Warrior: 4x Splinter Rifle . Sybarite: Blast Pistol Wyches [12 PL, 250pts] . Hekatrix: Blast Pistol, Power sword . 16x Wych: 16x Hekatarii blade, 16x Splinter Pistol . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and Impaler . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and Impaler . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler Wyches [6 PL, 150pts] . Hekatrix: Blast Pistol, Power sword . 6x Wych: 6x Hekatarii blade, 6x Splinter Pistol . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler Wyches [6 PL, 150pts] . Hekatrix: Blast Pistol, Power sword . 6x Wych: 6x Hekatarii blade, 6x Splinter Pistol . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler . Wych with Wych Weapon: Shardnet and impaler + Fast Attack + Reavers [14 PL, 317pts]: 4x Grav-Talon . Arena Champion: Power sword . 7x Reaver: 7x Bladevanes, 7x Splinter pistol, 7x Splinter rifle . Reaver with special weapon (up to 1 for 3 models): Blaster . Reaver with special weapon (up to 1 for 3 models): Blaster . Reaver with special weapon (up to 1 for 3 models): Blaster . Reaver with special weapon (up to 1 for 3 models): Blaster Scourges [7 PL, 130pts] . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Blaster . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Blaster . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Haywire blaster . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Haywire blaster . Solarite: Blast Pistol Scourges [7 PL, 130pts] . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Blaster . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Blaster . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Haywire blaster . Scourge with Special / Heavy weapon: Haywire blaster . Solarite: Blast Pistol + Flyer + Razorwing Jetfighter [8 PL, 160pts]: Twin splinter rifle . 2 Dark Lances: 2x Dark Lance + Dedicated Transport + Raider [5 PL, 95pts]: Disintegrator cannon Raider [5 PL, 97pts]: Disintegrator cannon, Grisly Trophies ++ Total: [97 PL, 11CP, 1,999pts] ++ Created with BattleScribe (https://battlescribe.net)

WRITING.TITLE: My try on Genestealer Cult Melee/Shooty
WRITING.TEXT: This is my list for 9th that i couldn't test yet. I made the decision to play goliaths instead of ridgerunners because I don't have that are the models I own. The general plan is to have the FAE detachment to either shock in and stop an enemys advance second or third turn and have the broodbrothers and rusted claw units start on the board turn 1. The Magus and jackal alphus are going to mark a target turn 1 and try to focus all the mining lasers at it to take it out. Thanks for reading this, I'll happily take your advice. ++ Battalion Detachment 0CP (Tyranids - Genestealer Cults) [61 PL, 11CP, 1,128pts] ++ + Configuration + Battle Size [12CP]: 3. Strike Force (101-200 Total PL / 1001-2000 Points) Cult Creed: Cult of the Four-Armed Emperor Detachment CP + Stratagems + Broodcoven [-1CP] + HQ + Acolyte Iconward [3 PL, 60pts]: Icon of the Cult Ascendant Patriarch [7 PL, 135pts]: Power: Mass Hypnosis, Power: Might From Beyond, Warlord, Warlord Trait: Inscrutable Cunning Primus [4 PL, 85pts]: Bonesword, Broodcoven Primus, Warlord Trait: Alien Majesty + Troops + Acolyte Hybrids [6 PL, 130pts]: Cult Icon . 7x Acolyte Hybrid (Hand Flamer): 7x Blasting Charges, 7x Cultist Knife, 7x Hand Flamer, 7x Rending Claw . Acolyte Hybrid (Heavy Weapon): Hand Flamer, Heavy Rock Saw . Acolyte Hybrid (Heavy Weapon): Hand Flamer, Heavy Rock Saw . Acolyte Leader: Cultist Knife, Hand Flamer Acolyte Hybrids [6 PL, 120pts]: Cult Icon . 6x Acolyte Hybrid (Hand Flamer): 6x Blasting Charges, 6x Cultist Knife, 6x Hand Flamer, 6x Rending Claw . Acolyte Hybrid (Heavy Weapon): Hand Flamer, Heavy Rock Saw . Acolyte Hybrid (Heavy Weapon): Hand Flamer, Heavy Rock Saw . Acolyte Leader: Cultist Knife, Hand Flamer Acolyte Hybrids [6 PL, 58pts] . 4x Acolyte Hybrid: 4x Autopistol, 4x Blasting Charges, 4x Cultist Knife, 4x Rending Claw . Acolyte Hybrid (Heavy Weapon): Autopistol, Demolition Charge . Acolyte Leader: Autopistol, Cultist Knife Brood Brothers Infantry Squad [3 PL, 50pts]: Brood Brothers Leader . 9x Brood Brother: 9x Frag Grenades, 9x Lasgun Brood Brothers Infantry Squad [3 PL, 50pts]: Brood Brothers Leader . 9x Brood Brother: 9x Frag Grenades, 9x Lasgun + Elites + Aberrants [9 PL, 160pts] . 5x Aberrant (Pick): 5x Power Pick, 5x Rending Claw Biophagus [2 PL, 40pts] Clamavus [3 PL, 60pts] Nexos [3 PL, 55pts] + Heavy Support + Goliath Rockgrinder [6 PL, 125pts]: Clearance Incinerator, Heavy Stubber ++ Patrol Detachment -2CP (Tyranids - Genestealer Cults) [50 PL, -2CP, 872pts] ++ + Configuration + Cult Creed: The Bladed Cog Detachment CP [-2CP] + HQ + Jackal Alphus [4 PL, 75pts] Magus [5 PL, 85pts]: Broodcoven Magus, Power: Mind Control, Power: Undying Vigour, Warlord Trait: Single-minded Obsession + Troops + Neophyte Hybrids [4 PL, 80pts] . 7x Neophyte Hybrid: 7x Autogun, 7x Autopistol, 7x Blasting Charges . 2x Neophyte Hybrid (Mining): 2x Autopistol, 2x Blasting Charges, 2x Mining Laser . Neophyte Leader: Autopistol, Chainsword Neophyte Hybrids [4 PL, 75pts] . 2x Neophyte Hybrid: 2x Autogun, 2x Autopistol, 2x Blasting Charges . Neophyte Hybrid (Mining): Mining Laser . 5x Neophyte Hybrid (Shotgun): 5x Autopistol, 5x Blasting Charges, 5x Shotgun . Neophyte Hybrid (Stubber): Heavy Stubber . Neophyte Leader: Autogun, Autopistol + Elites + Kelermorph [4 PL, 80pts] Sanctus [3 PL, 65pts]: Silencer Sniper Rifle + Fast Attack + Achilles Ridgerunners [4 PL, 70pts] . Achilles Ridgerunner: Flare Launcher, Heavy Mining Laser, 2x Heavy Stubber Atalan Jackals [12 PL, 172pts] . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Jackal: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Leader: Cultist Knife, Shotgun . Atalan Wolfquad: Mining Laser, Shotgun . WRITING.TITLE: My try on GSC melee/shooty
WRITING.TEXT: This is my list for 9th that i couldn't test yet. I made the decision to play goliaths instead of ridgerunners because I don't have that are the models I own. The general plan is to have the FAE detachment to either shock in and stop an enemys advance second or third turn and have the broodbrothers and rusted claw units start on the board turn 1. The Magus and jackal alphus are going to mark a target turn 1 and try to focus all the mining lasers at it to take it out. My meta are mostly Ironhands, Orks and some Death Guard. We will play the normal 9th missions. Thanks for reading this, I'll happily take your advice. ++ Battalion Detachment 0CP (Tyranids - Genestealer Cults) [61 PL, 11CP, 1,128pts] ++ + Configuration + Battle Size [12CP]: 3. And they are part of my narrative with the Biophagus being the heart of my army lorewise

Thanks for your advice, why do the Neophytes in the goliaths not get the buff from the jackal alphus? My general plan to get into combat is having a 7 inch charge with FAE and the clamavus to not rely on a perfect ambush

WRITING.TITLE: Spacepirate Genestealers
WRITING.TEXT: This is my approach on a home brew GSC army which is lead by a Doctor, who managed to implant psy-blocking devices inside of various Genestealer Hybrids, cutting them from the Primarchs influence and link them to his own mind. This connection from then on works like the Techpriest and Skitarii connection, so the Doctor can send his orders straight into the heads of the cultists. He then proceeded to capture more imperial, aeldari and other vessels to form a fleet of pirates ravaging through space with the fiercest strength the former cultists can offer. The looted weapons and goods are used to reinforce and expand his fleet. Thanks for reading This idea came to my head because I don't like the thought of having my cultists devoured by the Nids after their job and because space pirates are awesome. What do you think of it?
Thanks mate

Im thinking of calling them Dr. Nebugliars Limbstealers, because some of the other humans in his fleet have some drukhari tendencies to take limbs of their victims or in this case other genestealers and sew them to their bodies
Mine too, my leader is a Biophagus with feather wings from the drukhari scourge sprues. And 20 Abberants, that's the core of my army.
This does sound a lot like actual governments, i like the idea
Well yes, that fits better

I think you can pretty easily play some troop choices like brood brothers and neophytes with obsec to secure back and midfield objectives. Or some melee acolytes as troops with a few buff chars. So no need to spam ridgerunners. Abberants are also fun.
Looks bomb fellow cultist! The yellow looks a bit used and rugged which fits the model perfectly.
Do you have an idea how I could achieve this in gray? And yes, my life for the true emperor, who is going to free us from oppression

It's definitely still viable as you will have the opportunity to remove screens with the new 12 inch handflamers and then use your bonus on the charge. This is, with twisted helix, the best melee cult but the choice is dependent on your meta. With a lot of Marines and other T4 armies id choose twisted helix to get the chance to wound on 3, if your meta is alot of T3 armies you can safely go C4AE. And try to lose the purestrains out of your army if you want to get competitive, they are pretty expensive for their output. I hope this helps you.
GSC Acolyte Hybrids just had the best day in their lives, 20 D6 12' flamer bomb here we come
Good job fellow cultist, face and weapon could need some shade maybe, the basing is pretty awesome
Stunning job mate
These make excellent larvae, impressive job right there
A unit of Neophytes doesn't fit into a Rockgrinder, or would you deepstrike them separately?
Could you give some height reference? Lik som propa boyz
That's a chonk
Fucking disgusting to be honest. Great work
Seriously awesome job right there. Straight up disgusting

Well I guess you will have some buffs on the Reanimation Protocols like dice added to the dice pool or some reroll through new aura abilities. The new Reanimation Protocols are propably going to be quite awesome in my opinion. The Command protocols are difficult to be honest.
He's not dead. And he will never be dead. Gorbad lives. Not like poor Skarsnik that cute boi.
Don't buy them if you don't really like the modules tbh, they are pretty overcosted for what they do
Baron Veigar is my favorite

Thanks for this post mate, I'm looking forward to the comments. My guess for 9th are Flamepistol Acolytes with saws for objective grapping as Flamepistols will be 12 inch soon. And of course some mining laser neophytes for anti tank. Maybe some bikes for early midboard control and objective rushing. And Goliaths as they can now move and shoot without penalty and transports are generally strong in 9th.
Great man, looks like a lot of LSD or something right there, awesome job, and your lore comment is also great
Do these have rules in 40k?
Sad binary noises

WRITING.TITLE: Hoplites/Peltasts or Thermite Drill?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey fellow Toasterlovers, I'm thinking about getting some Forgeworld goodness for my admech and I'm swinging between Hoplites, Peltasts and a Thermite Drill. I already have around 1.8k points featuring 2 dunecrawlers, 10 fulgurites, 5 infiltrators, 40 ranger/vanguard, 2 kastellans, a ballustari, cawl and 3 dominus and a engineseer. What would you guys recommend? Thanks ahead and for the Omnissiah!
Looks like the scene from LOTR where Frodo and the other Hobbits hide from the Nazgul in the forest. I hope you know what I mean. Looks dope mate, sad cultist
Thanks for this mate, I guess I'll wait for now. The knights are also a neat idea
I can feel you mate and I'm so happy for you. Keep up the amazing work
Is the lava painted or led? I honestly can't tell from looking. It's an awesome piece of terrain and work to be sure
This reminds me of the battle between Thorin and Ahzhog in the Hobbit movie, where Azhog floats in the frozen river. Great job mate

WRITING.TITLE: Forgeworld Battle-Automata
WRITING.TEXT: Do you guys think we could be getting some of the big Forgeworld Battle-Automata like the Castellax or the Thanatar in 40k or is there no chance for this to happen?
I'd go with what you think is cool looking, I really like the phosphor blast pistol + arc maul like on the cover of the codex

Dominus 2 barebones troops of rangers/vanguard for objectives 1 ballistarii with las/auto cannon 2 triple phosphor kastellans Gives you some objective control possibilities, anti horde/anti tank. You can use a stratagem to shoot the deepstriking warriors so they can't harm you anymore
Thanks mate, grandpapi makes sense
Thanks mate, the Google image of the Giant's Causeway were my actual reference I made this from
Thanks mate, I have him completed, just have to take some nice pictures now

WRITING.TITLE: Holy Order Warlord Trait and Cawl
WRITING.TEXT: Is it possible to have a HOWT in a army with Belisarius Cawl?
But doesn't call have a rule that says he has to be your Warlord if you field him or am I remembering something wrong there?
Okay, thanks for your answers, isn't this comp of reroll all hits plus additional hits on 6s ridiculously overpowered?
If Cawl doesn't keep his bubble I doubt he will see a lot of play anymore, I mean why would you take him then?

WRITING.TITLE: Secondaries against Maroney
WRITING.TEXT: Has anyone got some advice which secondaries I should take against a Iron Hands marine force when I'm playing a Cawl castle with some small infantry squads?

This sounds like some helpful advice, my list features Cawl some Kastellans, Dunecrawlers 4-5 small troops of rangers/vanguard a techpriest dominus for the infantry rerolls and a Ironstrider. Hope this makes your help a little easier. But already thanks for your advice
I'm aiming for 2k points, I just don't have a optimized list yet. I own some plasma kataphrons, fulgurites and infiltrators too if that changes stuff up

WRITING.TITLE: The great-great-great grandfather of robots is complete

WRITING.TEXT: Please give me some C amp;C as this is my basically first model
I would make a healthy mix of vanguard and rangers and definitely use all special weapons as this makes the minis look really cool and fits the kill team specialist shenanigans

Thanks mate, it's basically the first model I started painting four years ago. I might haveade 3k points GSC/Nids in the meantime until I felt good enough for Cawl. I'm going to varnish him and if you say I should do it indoors I'll maybe try it in the basement. And the highlights on the robes will also be tried and hopefully improved. Again thanks my fellow techpriest
Which colors would you say for the robes, for purple as for the red
That one looks crazy good, I luckily have all the paints you mentioned at home so I'm gonna head straight into painting the highlights, wish me luck
I had that frosting effect on my GSC infantry and I was so sad, I'm gonna do it indoors for sure now
Thanks mate, I sure hope he will
Yes it is for sure
So he stands out, that's how we do it in my gaming group in general and I like them looking over their forces
How much does such a beauty cost irl?
How is he dying in every game? You have to castle your shooting units around him so he can't get shot and you can make use of his aura, can you say which units you use beside him?
That's a snack
Why tho?

My way to deal with the Golden Bois were my Kastellans all the time, having 2 to 4 just shooting them with wrath of Mars and Cawl rerolls kills them pretty easy in my experience. Add in 2 Onagers with Icarus stations and they will vanish pretty quickly

Yes, I would look for a deploying space which offers you some firing arks, which you will need in 9th Editon terrain setup, but this had worked in my games where we use a lot of LOS blocking terrain. You can use the kastellans to screen your Onagers and let them overwatch with 72 shots and full Cawl rerolls
I would paint them in a mix of your Forgeworlds colors and your knight house colors, as they are the titan guard
Lies! Deception!
